entry.title: Yazathingyan (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that crown prince of Ava Minye Kyawswa (pictured) discarded advice from Yazathingyan, and subsequently got slain in battle?

entry.title: Roller Soaker (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that riding on the Roller Soaker was described as going through a "car wash with the top down"?

entry.title: John Hemsley (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that British Army brigadier John Hemsley and his wife set a record time for travel by car from Cape Town to London in 1983?

entry.title: Hands On (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Kanye West's "Hands On" marked Fred Hammond's first appearance on the US Billboard Hot 100?

entry.title: Víctor Hugo Zamora (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that some analysts considered Víctor Hugo Zamora's appointment as hydrocarbons minister to be a gesture to oil companies, guaranteeing "covert continuity" between the Áñez and Morales governments?

entry.title: Christy Martin vs. Deirdre Gogarty (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Christy Martin vs. Deirdre Gogarty has been called the fight that "put women's boxing on the map"?

entry.title: Ann Beaglehole (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that former child refugee Ann Beaglehole has become a historian specialising in refugee history?

entry.title: Make Me Prime Minister (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that one reviewer of the British reality TV series Make Me Prime Minister said "Technically it's worth five stars. In every other way, I wish I was dead"?
